cip.render.utilColour

Class RGBf

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.utilColour.RGBf

  • public class RGBf
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing an RGB colour of single precision (the components are represented by float values), hence the name RGBf.

    This class implements the basic functionality for an RGB colour as required for rendering and 3D graphics use. This class is patterned after and most code adapted from the CRGBf class of the JOEY toolkit written and distributed by Crisis in Perspective, Inc. Additionally, the normalized RGB sampling for spectral curves as described in Hall, "Comparing Spectral Computation Methods", IEEE Computer Graphics and Applications, July 1999 is implemented as part of this class.

    Since:
    1.0

      • setValue

        public RGBf setValue(java.lang.String strSpectralFile,
                     boolean bLight)
        Sets this RGB colour to be a metamer for a spectral curve.
        Parameters:
        strSpectralFile - The file containing the spectral data.
        bLight - true if this is a light source, false otherwise. If true, the RGB components are set per the CIEXYZ sampling and transformation into RGB. If false the sampling is normalized to be a reflectance value using the normalization that would result in a perfect mirror having a RGB reflectance of 1,1,1
        Returns:
        Returns this RGB colour after its value has been set.

      • setValue

        public RGBf setValue(org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                     boolean bLight)
        Sets the value of this RGB colour from the attributes of an XML DOM Element. Colours are specified through attributes so that the element tag can be used to identify how the colour should be applied - for example, an object may have several colour components in the object definition. The colour is specified either as an RGB value, or, loaded from a spectral curve as follows: 
             <someTag rgb="r,g,b"
              scale="scale"/>
        or: 
             <someTag spectral="spectralFileName"
              scale="scale"/>
        where:
        rgb The colour as specified as an r,g,b value. R, g, and b are normally specified in the range 0-1.
        spectral The colour as specified in a spectral curve description. The spectral curve will be sampled using the CIEXYZ 1931 standard observer 2 degree FOV curves and then converted to RGB based on the primary chromaticities used to initialize the RGBf class.
        scale A multiplier for the colour or spectral curve. Generally this would ony be used with spectral curves for light sources which are normalized to an average intensity of 1 when they are read. The default is a scale of 1 (i.e. no scale is applied) if unspecified.

        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The XML DOM Element.
        bLight - true if this is a light source, false otherwise. bLight is used only if the RGB colour is being initialized from spectral curve data, and it controls how the CIEXYZ sampling to RGB is normalized.
        Returns:
        Returns this RGB colour after its value has been set.

      • toXmlAttr

        public void toXmlAttr(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Adds the RGB definition attribute to the XML DOM element.
        Parameters:
        element - The element the colour attribute should be added to.

      • scale

        public RGBf scale(float fScale)
        Scales this RGB colour by a scalar. This is a common operation in illumination computations when scaling the material reflectance based on the surface roughness. Each of the components are multiplied by the scale factor.
        Parameters:
        fScale - The scale factor.
        Returns:
        Returns the RGB colour after scaling.

      • add

        public RGBf add(RGBf rgb)
        Add another RGB colour to this one. This is a common operation in illumination when summing the illumination contributions of multiple lights. This is a component-wise addition of the colours.
        Parameters:
        rgb - The RGB colour that will be added to this one.
        Returns:
        Returns this colour after addition.

      • mult

        public RGBf mult(RGBf rgb)
        Multiplies this RGB colour by another. This is a common operation in illumination computations when multiplying the incident light by the reflectance of a surface. This is a component-wise multiplication of the colours.
        Parameters:
        rgb - The RGB colour that will be multiplied with this colour.
        Returns:
        Returns this colour after multiplication.

      • clamp

        public RGBf clamp()
        Clamps the red, green, and blue colour components to be in the range 0.0 to 1.0. NOTE that clamping in this context means setting colour component < 0.0 to 0.0 and any colour component > 1.0 to 1.0. A color clamped in this fashion may change hue, saturation, and value.
        Returns:
        Returns this RGB colour after clamping.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(RGBf rgb)
        Tests another RGB colour, rgb, for equality with this RGB colour.
        Parameters:
        rgb - The RGB colour to be tested. This colour is unchanged.
        Returns:
        Returns true if rgb is equal to this RGB colour(identical in all components), and false otherwise.
